page.title: 14School events at Fearn.
page.content: On 28th August 1984,Mr.Young,the High Commissioner for New Zealand came to our school to celebrate the centenary of the birth of Peter Fraser,war time Prime Minister of N.Z..Mr.Young was presented with a picture of our school and extracts from the school logbook recording Peter Fraser's visits. His wife received a bouquet. Some of the boys were given gold coloured badges in the shape of a kiwi.Mr.Young gave the school a book on New Zealand rugby.Every summer, school sports are held on the football pitch.Race winners receive a small money prize - 10p.for first,5p. for second and 2p.for third.At the end everyone has juice,crisps and a biscuit.In December, our school holds an annual Christmas concert.Each class sings two carols and finally the whole school sings a carol together.
